name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: This lecture is about query likelihood and probabilistic retrieval model.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _In this lecture

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: we continue the discussion of probabilistic retrieval model.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _In particular

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: we're going to talk about the query likelihood of the retrieval function.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: In the query of likelihood retrieval model our idea is a model.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _How a likely a user
column6: who likes a document would pose a particular query. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So in this case
column6: you can imagine

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: if a user likes this particular document about the presidential campaign news.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Then we can assume
column6: the user would use this _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: working as a basis to oppose a query to try and retrieve this doc.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So you can imagine the user
column6: could use a process that works as follows

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: we assume that the query is generated by sampling words from the document.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So for example
column6: a user might pick a word like _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _presidential from this document
column6: and then use this as a query word. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _And then the user would pick another word
column6: like campaign and _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: that would be the second query word.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Now this
column6: of course

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _is assumption that we have made about
column6: how a user would post a query. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: Whether a user actually followed this process.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: Maybe a different question.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _But this assumption

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: has allowed us to formally characterize this conditional probability.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: And this allows to also not rely on the big table that I showed you earlier

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: to use imperative data to estimate this probability.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: And this is why we can use this idea to then further derive

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: retrieval function that we can implement with the languages.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So
column6: as you see
column7: the assumption that we've made here is

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _is independent in this sample
column6: and also

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: each word is basically obtained from the document.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: So now let's see how this works exactly.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Well
column6: since we are computing a query likelihood

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _then the probability here is just the probability of this particular query

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: which is a sequence of words.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: And we make the assumption that each word is generated independently.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So
column6: as a result
column7: the probability of the query is just a product _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: of the probability of each query word.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Now
column6: how do we compute the probability of each query word? _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Well
column6: based on the assumption

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _that a word is picked from the document
column6: that the user has in mind. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Now we know the probability of each word is just the

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: the relative frequency of the word in the document.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So
column6: for example the probability of presidential given the document

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _would be just the count of presidential in the document

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: divided by the total number of words in the document or document length.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So with this these assumptions
column6: we now have actual simple formula for _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _retrieval
column6: right? _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: We can use this to rank our document.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: So does this model work?

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Let's take a look
column6: here are some example documents that you have seen before. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: Suppose now the query is presidential campaign.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: And we see the formula here on the top.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: So how do we score these documents?

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Well it's very simple
column6: right
column7: we just count how many times we have seen _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _presidential
column6: how many times we have seen campaign etc. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _And see here 44 and we've seen president Jou Tai

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: so that's two over the lands of document the four.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: Multiply by 1 over lands of document of 4 for the probability of

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: campaign and seeming we can probabilities for the other two documents.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Now if you'll look at this
column6: these numbers or these

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _scoring all these documents
column6: it seems to make sense because

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _d4 have about the same length
column6: then it looks like we will rank d4 _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _above d3 and which is above d2
column6: right? _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _And as we would expect
column6: looks like it did capture the tf heuristic. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: And so this seems to work well.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _However
column6: if we try a different query like this one

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _presidential campaign update
column6: then we might see a problem. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: But what problem?

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Well
column6: think about update
column7: now none of these documents has mentioned update. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: So according to our assumption that a user would pick a order from a document

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _to generate a query

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: then the probability of obtaining a word like update would be what.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Would be zero
column6: right? _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So that cause a problem
column6: because it would cause all these documents _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: to have zero probability of generating this query.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Now
column6: while it's fine to have a zero probability for d2 which is not relevant. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: It's not okay to have zero for d3 and

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
column6: because now we no longer can distinguish them. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _What's worse
column6: we can't even distinguish them from d 2. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _All right
column6: so that's obviously not desirable. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Now when one has such result
column6: we should think about what has caused this problem. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So we have to examine what assumptions have been made

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: as we derive this ranking function.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: Now if you examine those assumptions carefully you would realize.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _What has caused this problem
column6: right? _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So
column6: take a moment to think about
column7: what do you think is the reason why _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _update has zero probability
column6: and how do we fix it? _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: Right?

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So
column6: if you think about this for the moment that you realize that. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: That's because we have made an assumption

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: that every query word must be drawn from the document in the user's mind.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So
column6: in order to fix this

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _the user could have drawn a word
column6: not necessarily from the document. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: So let's see improved model.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _An improvement here is to say that

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _well
column6: instead of drawing a word from the document

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: would actually draw a word from a document model and so I show a model here.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Here we assume that this document is generated

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: by using this unigram image model.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Now
column6: this model
column7: doesn't necessarily assign zero probability for update. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: In fact we assume this model does not assign zero probability for any word.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: Now if we're thinking this way then the generation

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: process is a little bit different.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Now the user has this model in mind
column6: instead of this particular document. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: Although the model has to be estimated based on the document.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: So the user can again generate the query using a similar process.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _They may pick a word
column6: for example presidential and another word campaign. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Now the difference is that
column6: this time we can also pick a word like update

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: even though update it doesn't occur in the document

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: to potentially generate a query word like update.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So that
column6: a query was updated we want to have zero probabilities. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So this would fix our problem and it's also reasonable

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _because we're now thinking of what the user is looking for in a more general way

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: that is unique language model instead of a fixed document.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So how do we compute this query

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _like if we make this sum where it involves two steps
column6: right? _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _The first is the computer's model
column6: and we call it talking the language model here. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _For example
column6: I have shown two possible energy models here. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: This has been based on two documents.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: And then given a query and I get a mining algorithms.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _The second step
column6: is just to compute the likelihood of this query. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _And by making independence assumptions
column6: we could then have this probability as _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _a product of the probability of each query word
column6: all right? _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: But we do this for both documents.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: And then we're going to score these two documents and then rank them.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: So that's the basic idea of this query likelihood retrieval function.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: So more generally than this ranking function would look like the following and

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _here as
column6: we assume that query has end words W1 through WN. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _And then the scoring function
column6: the ranking function is the probability _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _that we observe this query
column6: given that the user is thinking of this document. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: And this assumed to be product of probabilities of all individual words and

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: this is based on the independence assumption.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Now we actually often score the
column6: document for _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _this query by using log of the query likelihood
column6: as shown on the sigma line. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: Now we do this to avoid having a lot of small probabilities.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _M
column6: multiplied together. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: And this could cause underflow and

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: we might lose precision by transforming the value as a logarithm function.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _We maintain the order of these documents
column6: yet we can avoid the end of flow problem. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: So if we take longer than transformation of coarse the product that would become

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _a sum
column6: as you stake in the line here. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So it's a sum of all of the query words
column6: and inside the sum _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: that is log of the probability of this word given by the document.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _And then we can further rewrite the sum
column6: into a different form. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So in the first of the sum here
column6: in this sum

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: we have it over all the query words n query words.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _And in this sum
column6: we have a sum of all the possible words but _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: we put a counter here of each word in the query.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Essentially we are only considering the words in the query

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _because if a word is not in the query
column6: it can would be zero. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: So we're still considering only these end words.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _But we're using a different form as if we were going to a sum of all the words

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: in the vocabulary.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: And of course a word might occur multiple times in the query.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _That's wh
column6: why we have a count here. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: And then this part is

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: log of the probability of the word given by the document MG model.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So you can see
column6: in this material function

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: we actually know the count of the word in the query.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So
column6: the only thing that we don't know is this document language model. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Therefore
column6: we can convert through the retrieval problem _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: into the problem of estimating this document language model.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _So that we can compute
column6: the probability of each query we're given by this document. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _At different estimation methods here
column6: would lead to different ranking functions. _

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _And this is just like a different a ways to place a doc in the vector

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: in the vector space.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: Would lead it to a different ranking function in the vector space model.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: _Here are different ways to estimate this stuff in the language model

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: will lead you to a different ranking function for query likelihood.

name: 4 - 3 - 3.3 Query Likelihood Retrieval Function (00-12-07).srt
text: [MUSIC]
